headline: International Paper’s Q2 Earnings Call: Our Top 5 Analyst Questions
summary: International Paper’s second quarter saw revenue growth driven by the full integration of DS Smith and price realization, but cost pressures and operational hurdles weighed on profitability. The market responded negatively to the results, as management acknowledged that cost performance in North America and EMEA was below expectations, with ongoing mill reliability issues leading to missed profit opportunities. headline: IP Q2 Deep Dive: Transformation Progress Continues Amid Margin Pressures and Mixed Market Conditions
summary: Packaging and materials company International Paper (NYSE:IP) reported Q2 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 42.9% year on year to $6.77 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.20 per share was 51.1% below analysts’ consensus estimates.
